contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox settlement |name = Sas van Gent |image_shield = Wapen-SasvanGent.jpg |coordinates_display = inline,title |coordinates_region = NL |subdivision_type = [[List of sovereign states|Country]] |subdivision_name = [[Netherlands]] |subdivision_type1 = Province |subdivision_name1 = [[Zeeland (province)|Zeeland]] |subdivision_type2 = Municipality |subdivision_name2 = [[Terneuzen (municipality)|Terneuzen]] |latNS = N |longEW = E |latd = 51 |latm = 13 |lats = 40 |longd = 3 |longm = 47 |longs = 50 |area_km2 = 1.41 |population = 3753 |population_as_of = 31-12-2008 |density = |website = http://www.sasvangent.nl |image_map = Map NL - Terneuzen - Sas van Gent.png |image_map1 = LocatieTerneuzen.png |map_caption1 = The town centre (dark green) and the statistical district (light green) of Sas van Gent in the municipality of Terneuzen. }} '''Sas van Gent''' ({{Coord|51|14|N|3|48|E|type:city(3854)}}) is a town in the Netherlands. It is located in the [[Netherlands|Dutch]] province of [[Zeeland]]. It is a part of the municipality of [[Terneuzen]] and lies about 30 km south of [[Vlissingen]] on the border with [[Belgium]]. The [[Ghent-Terneuzen Canal]] passes through Sas van Gent, and at that point there was a [[Canal lock|lock]] in the canal. The name of the village, ''Sas van Gent'', means ''sluice of Ghent''. ==History== Sas van Gent was a separate municipality until 2003, when it was merged with [[Terneuzen]].<ref>{{Repertorium Nederlandse Gemeenten}}</ref> The former municipality covered an area of 63.65 km² (of which 3.02 km² water). The former municipality of Sas van Gent also included the following towns, villages and townships: [[Philippine (Netherlands)|Philippine]], [[Westdorpe]], [[Zandstraat]]. All are now part of [[Terneuzen]]. ==Population and demographics== In 2001, the town of Sas van Gent had 3,854 inhabitants. The built-up area of the town was 2.5 km², and contained 1,843 residences.<ref name="CBS">Statistics Netherlands (CBS), [http://www.cbs.nl/nl-NL/menu/themas/milieu-natuur-ruimte/ruimte/publicaties/cartografie-geografie/geografische-data/2001-bevolkingskernen-in-nederland.htm ''Bevolkingskernen in Nederland 2001'']. (Statistics are for the continuous built-up area).</ref> The statistical area "Sas van Gent", which also can include the surrounding countryside, has a population of around 3,920 inhabitants.<ref name="CBS2">Statistics Netherlands (CBS), [http://statline.cbs.nl/ ''Statline: Kerncijfers wijken en buurten 2003-2005'']. As of 1 January 2005.</ref> ==Climate== Climate in this area has mild differences between highs and lows, and there is adequate rainfall year round. The [[Köppen Climate Classification]] subtype for this climate is "[[Köppen climate classification#GROUP C: Mild Temperate/mesothermal climates|Cfb]]" (Marine West Coast Climate/[[Oceanic climate]]).<ref>[http://www.weatherbase.com/weather/weather-summary.php3?s=13460&cityname=Gent%2C+East+Flanders%2C+Belgium&units= Climate Summary for closest city on record]</ref> ==References== <references/> ==External links== *{{Kuyper|Sas van Gent|ze|sasvangent}} Map of the former municipality, around 1868. *[http://www.sasvangent.nu Touristpage Sas van Gent] {{DEFAULTSORT:Sas Van Gent}} [[Category:Populated places in Zeeland]] [[Category:Former municipalities of Zeeland]] {{Zeeland-geo-stub}}
